mcqs.question: Which of the following is a valid CSS reset method?
mcqs.explanation: The rule `* { margin: 0; padding: 0; }` resets margin and padding for all elements.

mcqs.question: What is the purpose of a CSS reset?
options: To make all browsers render elements more consistently
To set all text to red
mcqs.explanation: A CSS reset aims to reduce browser inconsistencies in default styling.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is NOT a popular CSS reset or normalization library?
mcqs.explanation: Bootstrap is a CSS framework, not a reset. Normalize.css, Meyer's Reset, and Sanitize.css are resets.

mcqs.question: Why might you use Normalize.css instead of a traditional reset?
mcqs.explanation: Normalize.css aims to make browsers render elements consistently while preserving useful defaults.

mcqs.question: Where should you place a CSS reset in your stylesheet?
options: At the top, before your custom styles
mcqs.explanation: A CSS reset should be placed at the top so that your custom styles override it.

mcqs.question: What is the effect of using a reset on headings like `<h1>`?
options: It removes default font size and margin
mcqs.explanation: A CSS reset removes default margin, padding, and sometimes font size from headings.

mcqs.question: Which selector applies styles to all elements on a page?
mcqs.explanation: The universal selector `*` targets all elements.

mcqs.question: What is a drawback of using aggressive CSS resets?
options: They may remove useful default styles
mcqs.explanation: Aggressive resets can remove useful browser defaults, requiring you to re-add them manually.

mcqs.question: Which of the following is true about Normalize.css?
options: It makes elements look exactly the same in all browsers
It preserves some useful default styles
It must be loaded after your main CSS
It is only for mobile devices
mcqs.explanation: Normalize.css normalizes but doesn't remove all default styles.

mcqs.question: What is the main goal of a CSS normalization stylesheet?
mcqs.explanation: Normalization stylesheets provide a consistent look across browsers.

mcqs.question: What happens if you use both a reset and Normalize.css?
options: They may conflict, so choose one
mcqs.explanation: Using both can lead to conflicts. You should choose the one that best fits your needs.

mcqs.question: How can you remove all margin and padding from all elements?
mcqs.explanation: The universal selector `*` removes margin and padding from all elements.

mcqs.question: Which of these is a feature of Sanitize.css?
options: Normalizes styles and adds some improvements
mcqs.explanation: Sanitize.css normalizes browser styles and adds improvements.

mcqs.question: Why is it important to reset or normalize CSS?
options: To ensure consistent appearance in different browsers
mcqs.explanation: Resetting or normalizing ensures your website looks the same across browsers.

mcqs.question: Which is a best practice when using a CSS reset or normalization?
options: Customize it to your projectâ€™s needs
Put it at the bottom of your CSS
mcqs.explanation: Customize resets or normalization styles to fit your project for best results.
